issue.title: [Docs]Fix broken link in Python Development page
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14600](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14600). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The link in the third note is broken here:
https://arrow.apache.org/docs/developers/python.html#build-and-test

It's simply a matter of incorrect rst.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14600?focusedCommentId=17439051) by Daijiro Fukuda (daipom):*
This will solve the problem.

https://github.com/daipom/arrow/commit/261a9245038a0699eecf217fe6105434f0a17526

I would like to send pull request, but this is my first creating issue and I don't have any role,
so I can't assign me.

Could you assign me to the issue?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14600?focusedCommentId=17439072) by Alenka Frim (alenka):*
Hi `[~daipom]`, thank you for noticing!
I think you can make the PR already without having a role. And I will try to assign the issue to you.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14600?focusedCommentId=17439100) by Daijiro Fukuda (daipom):*
Thank you `[~alenkaf]`.

I have made the PR: <https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11620>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14600?focusedCommentId=17439110) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Issue resolved by pull request 11620
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11620>
